key.description:
Key of the module
One whitespace character (` `) can be used to hide the key

keyColor.description: Color of the module key to override the global setting `display.color.key`

keyWidth.description: Width of the module key to override the global setting `display.keyWidth`

keyIcon.description: Set the icon to be displayed by `display.keyType: "icon"`

outputColor.description: Output color of the module to override the global setting `display.color.output`

oneOf.description: 0 to use global setting, 1 for percentage number, 2 for multi-color bar, 3 for both, 6 for bar only, 9 for colored number, 10 for monochrome bar
Array of string flags

green.description: Values less than green will be shown in green

yellow.description:
Values greater than green and less than yellow will be shown in yellow.
Values greater than yellow will be shown in red

temperature.description: Detect and display temperature if supported

green.description: Values (in celsius) less than green will be shown in green

yellow.description:
Values (in celsius) greater than green and less than yellow will be shown in yellow.
Values greater than yellow will be shown in red

conditions.description: Only show the module if conditions are met

oneOf.description: Array of system names to match
Null to disable this condition
Array of system names to not match
Null to disable this condition
Array of architectures to match
Null to disable this condition
Array of architectures to not match
Null to disable this condition

succeeded.description: Whether the module succeeded in the last run

oneOf.description: True to only show the module if it succeeded, false to only show it if it failed
Null to disable this condition

spaceBeforeUnit.description: Whether to put a space before the unit

oneOf.description: Use the default behavior of the module
Always add a space before the unit
Never add a space before the unit

batteryFormat.description:
Output format of the module `Battery`. See Wiki for formatting syntax
    1. {manufacturer}: Battery manufacturer
    2. {model-name}: Battery model name
    3. {technology}: Battery technology
    4. {capacity}: Battery capacity (percentage num)
    5. {status}: Battery status
    6. {temperature}: Battery temperature (formatted)
    7. {cycle-count}: Battery cycle count
    8. {serial}: Battery serial number
    9. {manufacture-date}: Battery manufactor date
    10. {capacity-bar}: Battery capacity (percentage bar)
    11. {time-days}: Battery time remaining days
    12. {time-hours}: Battery time remaining hours
    13. {time-minutes}: Battery time remaining minutes
    14. {time-seconds}: Battery time remaining seconds
    15. {time-formatted}: Battery time remaining (formatted)

biosFormat.description:
Output format of the module `BIOS`. See Wiki for formatting syntax
    1. {date}: Bios date
    2. {release}: Bios release
    3. {vendor}: Bios vendor
    4. {version}: Bios version
    5. {type}: Firmware type

bluetoothFormat.description:
Output format of the module `Bluetooth`. See Wiki for formatting syntax
    1. {name}: Name
    2. {address}: Address
    3. {type}: Type
    4. {battery-percentage}: Battery percentage number
    5. {connected}: Is connected
    6. {battery-percentage-bar}: Battery percentage bar

bluetoothradioFormat.description:
Output format of the module `BluetoothRadio`. See Wiki for formatting syntax
    1. {name}: Radio name for discovering
    2. {address}: Address
    3. {lmp-version}: LMP version
    4. {lmp-subversion}: LMP subversion
    5. {version}: Bluetooth version
    6. {vendor}: Vendor
    7. {discoverable}: Discoverable
    8. {connectable}: Connectable / Pairable

boardFormat.description:
Output format of the module `Board`. See Wiki for formatting syntax
    1. {name}: Board name
    2. {vendor}: Board vendor
    3. {version}: Board version
    4. {serial}: Board serial number

bootmgrFormat.description:
Output format of the module `Bootmgr`. See Wiki for formatting syntax
    1. {name}: Name / description
    2. {firmware-path}: Firmware file path
    3. {firmware-name}: Firmware file name
    4. {secure-boot}: Is secure boot enabled
    5. {order}: Boot order

brightnessFormat.description:
Output format of the module `Brightness`. See Wiki for formatting syntax
    1. {percentage}: Screen brightness (percentage num)
    2. {name}: Screen name
    3. {max}: Maximum brightness value
    4. {min}: Minimum brightness value
    5. {current}: Current brightness value
    6. {percentage-bar}: Screen brightness (percentage bar)
    7. {is-builtin}: Is built-in screen

btrfsFormat.description:
Output format of the module `Btrfs`. See Wiki for formatting syntax
    1. {name}: Name / Label
    2. {uuid}: UUID
    3. {devices}: Associated devices
    4. {features}: Enabled features
    5. {used}: Size used
    6. {allocated}: Size allocated
    7. {total}: Size total
    8. {used-percentage}: Used percentage num
    9. {allocated-percentage}: Allocated percentage num
    10. {used-percentage-bar}: Used percentage bar
    11. {allocated-percentage-bar}: Allocated percentage bar
    12. {node-size}: Node size
    13. {sector-size}: Sector size

cameraFormat.description:
Output format of the module `Camera`. See Wiki for formatting syntax
    1. {name}: Device name
    2. {vendor}: Vendor
    3. {colorspace}: Color space
    4. {id}: Identifier
    5. {width}: Width (in px)
    6. {height}: Height (in px)

chassisFormat.description:
Output format of the module `Chassis`. See Wiki for formatting syntax
    1. {type}: Chassis type
    2. {vendor}: Chassis vendor
    3. {version}: Chassis version
    4. {serial}: Chassis serial number

commandFormat.description:
Output format of the module `Command`. See Wiki for formatting syntax
    1. {result}: Command result

cpuFormat.description:
Output format of the module `CPU`. See Wiki for formatting syntax
    1. {name}: Name
    2. {vendor}: Vendor
    3. {cores-physical}: Physical core count
    4. {cores-logical}: Logical core count
    5. {cores-online}: Online core count
    6. {freq-base}: Base frequency (formatted)
    7. {freq-max}: Max frequency (formatted)
    8. {temperature}: Temperature (formatted)
    9. {core-types}: Logical core count grouped by frequency
    10. {packages}: Processor package count
    11. {march}: X86-64 CPU microarchitecture

cpucacheFormat.description:
Output format of the module `CPUCache`. See Wiki for formatting syntax
    1. {result}: Separate result
    2. {sum}: Sum result

cpuusageFormat.description:
Output format of the module `CPUUsage`. See Wiki for formatting syntax
    1. {avg}: CPU usage (percentage num, average)
    2. {max}: CPU usage (percentage num, maximum)
    3. {max-index}: CPU core index of maximum usage
    4. {min}: CPU usage (percentage num, minimum)
    5. {min-index}: CPU core index of minimum usage
    6. {avg-bar}: CPU usage (percentage bar, average)
    7. {max-bar}: CPU usage (percentage bar, maximum)
    8. {min-bar}: CPU usage (percentage bar, minimum)

cursorFormat.description:
Output format of the module `Cursor`. See Wiki for formatting syntax
    1. {theme}: Cursor theme
    2. {size}: Cursor size

datetimeFormat.description:
Output format of the module `DateTime`. See Wiki for formatting syntax
    1. {year}: Year
    2. {year-short}: Last two digits of year
    3. {month}: Month
    4. {month-pretty}: Month with leading zero
    5. {month-name}: Month name
    6. {month-name-short}: Month name short
    7. {week}: Week number on year
    8. {weekday}: Weekday
    9. {weekday-short}: Weekday short
    10. {day-in-year}: Day in year
    11. {day-in-month}: Day in month
    12. {day-in-week}: Day in week
    13. {hour}: Hour
    14. {hour-pretty}: Hour with leading zero
    15. {hour-12}: Hour 12h format
    16. {hour-12-pretty}: Hour 12h format with leading zero
    17. {minute}: Minute
    18. {minute-pretty}: Minute with leading zero
    19. {second}: Second
    20. {second-pretty}: Second with leading zero
    21. {offset-from-utc}: Offset from UTC in the ISO 8601 format
    22. {timezone-name}: Locale-dependent timezone name or abbreviation
    23. {day-pretty}: Day in month with leading zero

deFormat.description:
Output format of the module `DE`. See Wiki for formatting syntax
    1. {process-name}: DE process name
    2. {pretty-name}: DE pretty name
    3. {version}: DE version

displayFormat.description:
Output format of the module `Display`. See Wiki for formatting syntax
    1. {width}: Screen configured width (in pixels)
    2. {height}: Screen configured height (in pixels)
    3. {refresh-rate}: Screen configured refresh rate (in Hz)
    4. {scaled-width}: Screen scaled width (in pixels)
    5. {scaled-height}: Screen scaled height (in pixels)
    6. {name}: Screen name
    7. {type}: Screen type (Built-in or External)
    8. {rotation}: Screen rotation (in degrees)
    9. {is-primary}: True if being the primary screen
    10. {physical-width}: Screen physical width (in millimeters)
    11. {physical-height}: Screen physical height (in millimeters)
    12. {inch}: Physical diagonal length in inches
    13. {ppi}: Pixels per inch (PPI)
    14. {bit-depth}: Bits per color channel
    15. {hdr-enabled}: True if high dynamic range (HDR) mode is enabled
    16. {manufacture-year}: Year of manufacturing
    17. {manufacture-week}: Nth week of manufacturing in the year
    18. {serial}: Serial number
    19. {platform-api}: The platform API used when detecting the display
    20. {hdr-compatible}: True if the display is HDR compatible
    21. {scale-factor}: HiDPI scale factor
    22. {preferred-width}: Screen preferred width (in pixels)
    23. {preferred-height}: Screen preferred height (in pixels)
    24. {preferred-refresh-rate}: Screen preferred refresh rate (in Hz)

diskFormat.description:
Output format of the module `Disk`. See Wiki for formatting syntax
    1. {size-used}: Size used
    2. {size-total}: Size total
    3. {size-percentage}: Size percentage num
    4. {files-used}: Files used
    5. {files-total}: Files total
    6. {files-percentage}: Files percentage num
    7. {is-external}: True if external volume
    8. {is-hidden}: True if hidden volume
    9. {filesystem}: Filesystem
    10. {name}: Label / name
    11. {is-readonly}: True if read-only
    12. {create-time}: Create time in local timezone
    13. {size-percentage-bar}: Size percentage bar
    14. {files-percentage-bar}: Files percentage bar
    15. {days}: Days after creation
    16. {hours}: Hours after creation
    17. {minutes}: Minutes after creation
    18. {seconds}: Seconds after creation
    19. {milliseconds}: Milliseconds after creation
    20. {mountpoint}: Mount point / drive letter
    21. {mount-from}: Mount from (device path)
    22. {years}: Years integer after creation
    23. {days-of-year}: Days of year after creation
    24. {years-fraction}: Years fraction after creation
    25. {size-free}: Size free
    26. {size-available}: Size available

diskioFormat.description:
Output format of the module `DiskIO`. See Wiki for formatting syntax
    1. {size-read}: Size of data read [per second] (formatted)
    2. {size-written}: Size of data written [per second] (formatted)
    3. {name}: Device name
    4. {dev-path}: Device raw file path
    5. {bytes-read}: Size of data read [per second] (in bytes)
    6. {bytes-written}: Size of data written [per second] (in bytes)
    7. {read-count}: Number of reads
    8. {write-count}: Number of writes

dnsFormat.description:
Output format of the module `DNS`. See Wiki for formatting syntax
    1. {result}: DNS result

editorFormat.description:
Output format of the module `Editor`. See Wiki for formatting syntax
    1. {type}: Type (Visual / Editor)
    2. {name}: Name
    3. {exe-name}: Exe name of real path
    4. {path}: Full path of real path
    5. {version}: Version

fontFormat.description:
Output format of the module `Font`. See Wiki for formatting syntax
    1. {font1}: Font 1
    2. {font2}: Font 2
    3. {font3}: Font 3
    4. {font4}: Font 4
    5. {combined}: Combined fonts for display

gamepadFormat.description:
Output format of the module `Gamepad`. See Wiki for formatting syntax

    2. {serial}: Serial number
    3. {battery-percentage}: Battery percentage num
    4. {battery-percentage-bar}: Battery percentage bar

gpuFormat.description:
Output format of the module `GPU`. See Wiki for formatting syntax
    1. {vendor}: GPU vendor
    2. {name}: GPU name
    3. {driver}: GPU driver
    4. {temperature}: GPU temperature
    5. {core-count}: GPU core count
    6. {type}: GPU type
    7. {dedicated-total}: GPU total dedicated memory
    8. {dedicated-used}: GPU used dedicated memory
    9. {shared-total}: GPU total shared memory
    10. {shared-used}: GPU used shared memory
    11. {platform-api}: The platform API used when detecting the GPU
    12. {frequency}: Current frequency in GHz
    13. {index}: GPU vendor specific index
    14. {dedicated-percentage-num}: Dedicated memory usage percentage num
    15. {dedicated-percentage-bar}: Dedicated memory usage percentage bar
    16. {shared-percentage-num}: Shared memory usage percentage num
    17. {shared-percentage-bar}: Shared memory usage percentage bar
    18. {core-usage-num}: Core usage percentage num
    19. {core-usage-bar}: Core usage percentage bar
    20. {memory-type}: Memory type (Windows only)

hostFormat.description:
Output format of the module `Host`. See Wiki for formatting syntax

iconsFormat.description:

    2. {icons2}: Icons part 2

Output format of the module `Locale`. See Wiki for formatting syntax

memoryFormat.description:
Output format of the module `Memory`. See Wiki for formatting syntax

monitorFormat.description:
Output format of the module `Monitor`. See Wiki for formatting syntax
    1. {name}: Display name
    2. {width}: Native resolution width in pixels
    3. {height}: Native resolution height in pixels
    4. {physical-width}: Physical width in millimeters
    5. {physical-height}: Physical height in millimeters
    6. {inch}: Physical diagonal length in inches
    7. {ppi}: Pixels per inch (PPI)
    8. {manufacture-year}: Year of manufacturing
    9. {manufacture-week}: Nth week of manufacturing in the year
    10. {serial}: Serial number
    11. {refresh-rate}: Maximum refresh rate in Hz
    12. {hdr-compatible}: True if the display is HDR compatible

mouseFormat.description:
Output format of the module `Mouse`. See Wiki for formatting syntax
    1. {name}: Mouse name
    2. {serial}: Mouse serial number

netioFormat.description:
Output format of the module `NetIO`. See Wiki for formatting syntax
    1. {rx-size}: Size of data received [per second] (formatted)
    2. {tx-size}: Size of data sent [per second] (formatted)
    3. {ifname}: Interface name
    4. {is-default-route}: Is default route
    5. {rx-bytes}: Size of data received [per second] (in bytes)
    6. {tx-bytes}: Size of data sent [per second] (in bytes)
    7. {rx-packets}: Number of packets received [per second]
    8. {tx-packets}: Number of packets sent [per second]
    9. {rx-errors}: Number of errors received [per second]
    10. {tx-errors}: Number of errors sent [per second]
    11. {rx-drops}: Number of packets dropped when receiving [per second]
    12. {tx-drops}: Number of packets dropped when sending [per second]

openclFormat.description:
Output format of the module `OpenCL`. See Wiki for formatting syntax
    1. {version}: Platform version
    2. {name}: Platform name
    3. {vendor}: Platform vendor

openglFormat.description:

    4. {slv}: OpenGL shading language version
    5. {library}: OpenGL library used

osFormat.description:
Output format of the module `OS`. See Wiki for formatting syntax
    1. {sysname}: Name of the kernel
    2. {name}: Name of the OS
    3. {pretty-name}: Pretty name of the OS, if available
    4. {id}: ID of the OS
    5. {id-like}: ID like of the OS
    6. {variant}: Variant of the OS
    7. {variant-id}: Variant ID of the OS
    8. {version}: Version of the OS
    9. {version-id}: Version ID of the OS
    10. {codename}: Version codename of the OS
    11. {build-id}: Build ID of the OS
    12. {arch}: Architecture of the OS

packagesFormat.description:
Output format of the module `Packages`. See Wiki for formatting syntax
    1. {all}: Number of all packages
    2. {pacman}: Number of pacman packages
    3. {pacman-branch}: Pacman branch on manjaro
    4. {dpkg}: Number of dpkg packages
    5. {rpm}: Number of rpm packages
    6. {emerge}: Number of emerge packages
    7. {eopkg}: Number of eopkg packages
    8. {xbps}: Number of xbps packages
    9. {nix-system}: Number of nix-system packages
    10. {nix-user}: Number of nix-user packages
    11. {nix-default}: Number of nix-default packages
    12. {apk}: Number of apk packages
    13. {pkg}: Number of pkg packages
    14. {flatpak-system}: Number of flatpak-system app packages
    15. {flatpak-user}: Number of flatpak-user app packages
    16. {snap}: Number of snap packages
    17. {brew}: Number of brew packages
    18. {brew-cask}: Number of brew-cask packages
    19. {macports}: Number of macports packages
    20. {scoop-user}: Number of scoop-user packages
    21. {scoop-global}: Number of scoop-global packages
    22. {choco}: Number of choco packages
    23. {pkgtool}: Number of pkgtool packages
    24. {paludis}: Number of paludis packages
    25. {winget}: Number of winget packages
    26. {opkg}: Number of opkg packages
    27. {am-system}: Number of am-system packages
    28. {sorcery}: Number of sorcery packages
    29. {lpkg}: Number of lpkg packages
    30. {lpkgbuild}: Number of lpkgbuild packages
    31. {guix-system}: Number of guix-system packages
    32. {guix-user}: Number of guix-user packages
    33. {guix-home}: Number of guix-home packages
    34. {linglong}: Number of linglong packages
    35. {pacstall}: Number of pacstall packages
    36. {mport}: Number of mport packages
    37. {am-user}: Number of am-user (aka appman) packages
    38. {pkgsrc}: Number of pkgsrc packages
    39. {hpkg-system}: Number of hpkg-system packages
    40. {hpkg-user}: Number of hpkg-user packages
    41. {pisi}: Number of pisi packages
    42. {soar}: Number of soar packages
    43. {nix-all}: Total number of all nix packages
    44. {flatpak-all}: Total number of all flatpak app packages
    45. {brew-all}: Total number of all brew packages
    46. {guix-all}: Total number of all guix packages
    47. {hpkg-all}: Total number of all hpkg packages

physicaldiskFormat.description:
Output format of the module `PhysicalDisk`. See Wiki for formatting syntax
    1. {size}: Device size (formatted)
    2. {name}: Device name
    3. {interconnect}: Device interconnect type
    4. {dev-path}: Device raw file path
    5. {serial}: Serial number
    6. {physical-type}: Device kind (SSD or HDD)
    7. {removable-type}: Device kind (Removable or Fixed)
    8. {readonly-type}: Device kind (Read-only or Read-write)
    9. {revision}: Product revision
    10. {temperature}: Device temperature (formatted)

physicalmemoryFormat.description:
Output format of the module `PhysicalMemory`. See Wiki for formatting syntax
    1. {bytes}: Size (in bytes)
    2. {size}: Size formatted
    3. {max-speed}: Max speed (in MT/s)
    4. {running-speed}: Running speed (in MT/s)
    5. {type}: Type (DDR4, DDR5, etc.)
    6. {form-factor}: Form factor (SODIMM, DIMM, etc.)
    7. {locator}: Bank/Device Locator (BANK0/SIMM0, BANK0/SIMM1, etc.)
    8. {vendor}: Vendor
    9. {serial}: Serial number
    10. {part-number}: Part number
    11. {is-ecc-enabled}: True if ECC enabled

    9. {seconds}: Seconds after login
    10. {milliseconds}: Milliseconds after login
    11. {years}: Years integer after login
    12. {days-of-year}: Days of year after login
    13. {years-fraction}: Years fraction after login

versionFormat.description:
Output format of the module `Version`. See Wiki for formatting syntax
    1. {project-name}: Project name
    2. {version}: Version
    3. {version-tweak}: Version tweak
    4. {build-type}: Build type (debug or release)
    5. {sysname}: System name
    6. {arch}: Architecture
    7. {cmake-built-type}: CMake build type when compiling (Debug, Release, RelWithDebInfo, MinSizeRel)
    8. {compile-time}: Date time when compiling
    9. {compiler}: Compiler used when compiling
    10. {libc}: Libc used when compiling

vulkanFormat.description:
Output format of the module `Vulkan`. See Wiki for formatting syntax
    1. {driver}: Driver name
    2. {api-version}: API version
    3. {conformance-version}: Conformance version
    4. {instance-version}: Instance version

wallpaperFormat.description:
Output format of the module `Wallpaper`. See Wiki for formatting syntax
    1. {file-name}: File name
    2. {full-path}: Full path

weatherFormat.description:
Output format of the module `Weather`. See Wiki for formatting syntax
    1. {result}: Weather result

wmFormat.description:
Output format of the module `WM`. See Wiki for formatting syntax
    1. {process-name}: WM process name
    2. {pretty-name}: WM pretty name
    3. {protocol-name}: WM protocol name
    4. {plugin-name}: WM plugin name
    5. {version}: WM version

wifiFormat.description:
Output format of the module `Wifi`. See Wiki for formatting syntax
    1. {inf-desc}: Interface description
    2. {inf-status}: Interface status
    3. {status}: Connection status
    4. {ssid}: Connection SSID
    5. {bssid}: Connection BSSID
    6. {protocol}: Connection protocol
    7. {signal-quality}: Connection signal quality (percentage num)
    8. {rx-rate}: Connection RX rate
    9. {tx-rate}: Connection TX rate
    10. {security}: Connection Security algorithm
    11. {signal-quality-bar}: Connection signal quality (percentage bar)
    12. {channel}: Connection channel number
    13. {band}: Connection channel band in GHz

wmthemeFormat.description:
Output format of the module `WMTheme`. See Wiki for formatting syntax
    1. {result}: WM theme

zpoolFormat.description:
Output format of the module `Zpool`. See Wiki for formatting syntax
    1. {name}: Zpool name
    2. {state}: Zpool state
    3. {used}: Size used
    4. {total}: Size total
    5. {used-percentage}: Size percentage num
    6. {fragmentation-percentage}: Fragmentation percentage num
    7. {used-percentage-bar}: Size percentage bar
    8. {fragmentation-percentage-bar}: Fragmentation percentage bar

title: JSON config
description: JSON config file for fastfetch. Usually located at `~/.config/fastfetch/config.jsonc`

$schema.description: JSON schema URL, for JSON validation and IDE intelligence

oneOf.description: Disable logo
Set the source file of the logo or built-in ASCII art name
Fastfetch logo configurations

type.description: Set the type of the logo

oneOf.description: If something is given, first try built-in, then file. Otherwise detect logo
Built-in ASCII art
Built-in ASCII art, small version (not all logos support this option)
Text file, printed with color code replacement
Text file, printed as is
Text data, printed with color code replacement
Text data, printed as is
Image file, printed as sixel codes
Image file, printed using kitty graphics protocol
Image file, tells the terminal emulator to read image data from the specified file
Image file, uses `kitten icat` to display the image. Requires binary `kitten` to be installed
Image file, uses `iTerm` image protocol
Image file, prints `ASCII` art image generated by `libchafa`
Image file, printed as `raw` binary string image
Disable logo printing

source.description: Set the source file of the logo

oneOf.description: Auto detect width (default)
Set the width of the logo (in characters). Required for some image protocols
Auto detect width (default)
Set the height of the logo (in characters). Required for some image protocols

padding.description: Set the padding of the logo

top.description: Set the top padding of the logo

left.description: Set the left padding of the logo

right.description: Set the right padding of the logo

printRemaining.description: Whether to print the remaining logo if it has more lines than modules to display

preserveAspectRatio.description: Whether to preserve the aspect ratio of the logo. Supported by iTerm image protocol only

recache.description: If true, regenerate image logo cache

position.description: Set the position where the logo should be displayed

chafa.description: Chafa configuration. See chafa documentation for details

fgOnly.description: Produce character-cell output using foreground colors only

symbols.description: Specify character symbols to employ in final output

canvasMode.description: Determine how colors are used in the output. This value maps to enum ChafaCanvasMode.

oneOf.description: Use 24-bit true colors
Use 256 colors
Use 240 colors, but avoid using the lower 16 whose values vary between terminal environments
Use 16 colors using the aixterm ANSI extension
Use default foreground and background colors, plus inversion
Use default foreground and background colors. No ANSI codes will be used
Use 8 colors, compatible with original ANSI X3.64
Use 16 FG colors (8 of which enabled with bold/bright) and 8 BG colors

colorSpace.description: Set color space used for quantization. This value maps to enum ChafaColorSpace.

oneOf.description: RGB color space. Fast but imprecise
DIN99d color space. Slower, but good perceptual color precision

ditherMode.description: Set output dither mode (No effect with 24-bit color). This value maps to enum ChafaDitherMode.

oneOf.description: No dithering
Ordered dithering (Bayer or similar)
Error diffusion dithering (Floyd-Steinberg or similar)

thread.description: Use separate threads for HTTP requests

escapeBedrock.description: On Bedrock Linux, whether to escape the bedrock jail

playerName.description: The name of the player to use for Media and Player modules. Linux only

dsForceDrm.description: Force display detection to use DRM. Linux only

oneOf.description: Try `wayland`, then `x11`, then `drm`
Use `/sys/class/drm` only
Try `libdrm` first, then `sysfs` if libdrm fails

wmiTimeout.description: Set the timeout (ms) for WMI queries, `-1` for no timeout. Windows only

processingTimeout.description: Set the timeout (ms) when waiting for child processes, `-1` for no timeout

preRun.description: Set the command to be executed before printing logos

detectVersion.description: Whether to detect and display component versions. Mainly for benchmarking

display.description: Configure how things should be displayed

stat.description: Show time usage (in ms) for individual modules with optional threshold

pipe.description: Whether to disable colors (auto-detected based on isatty(1) by default)

showErrors.description: Print occurring errors to the console. False to ignore errored modules

disableLinewrap.description: Whether to disable line wrap during execution

hideCursor.description: Whether to hide the cursor during execution

separator.description: Set the separator between key and value

color.description: Set the color of the keys and title

oneOf.description: Set both the colors of keys and title

keys.description: Set the color of the keys

title.description: Set the color of the title

output.description: Set the color of the module output

separator.description: Set the color of the key-value separator

brightColor.description: Set if the keys, title and ASCII logo should be printed in bright color

key.description: Set how module keys should be displayed

width.description: Align the width of keys to number of characters, 0 to disable

type.description: Set whether to show icon before string keys

oneOf.description: Disable keys
Show string keys
Show icon keys (requires newest nerd font)
Show both icon and string keys

paddingLeft.description: Set the left padding of keys

size.description: Set how size values should be displayed

binaryPrefix.description: Set the binary prefix to use when formatting sizes

oneOf.description: 1024 Bytes = 1 KiB, 1024 KiB = 1 MiB, ... (standard)

maxPrefix.description: Set the largest binary prefix to use when formatting sizes

ndigits.description: Set the number of digits to keep after the decimal point when formatting sizes

temp.description: Set how temperature values should be displayed

oneOf.description: Celsius
Fahrenheit
Kelvin
Default (alias for Celsius)

ndigits.description: Set the number of digits to keep after the decimal point when formatting temperature values

color.description: Set colors used in different states of temperature values

char.description: Set the characters used in the bar

elapsed.description: Set the character to use in elapsed part

total.description: Set the character to use in total part

oneOf.description: Disable bar borders
Set the string to use of borders of percentage bars

left.description: Set the string to use at left border

right.description: Set the string to use at right border

leftElapsed.description: If both leftElapsed and rightElapsed are set, the border will be used as parts of bar content

rightElapsed.description: If both leftElapsed and rightElapsed are set, the border will be used as parts of bar content

oneOf.description: Disable color in percentage bars
Set the color to use of percentage bars

elapsed.description:
Color to use in the elapsed part of percentage bars
By default, auto selected by percent.color.{green,yellow,red}

total.description: Color to use in the total part of percentage bars

border.description: Color to use in the borders of percentage bars

width.description: Set the width of the bar, in number of characters

percent.description: Set how percentage values should be displayed

ndigits.description: Set the number of digits to keep after the decimal point when formatting percentage numbers

color.description: Set colors used in different states of percentage bars and numbers

width.description: Set the width of the percentage number, in number of characters

freq.description: Set how frequency values should be displayed

ndigits.description: Set the number of decimal places to display when formatting frequency values

oneOf.description: Integer value displays the frequency in GHz with specified decimal places
Null value display the frequency as integer MHz

duration.description: Set how duration values should be displayed

abbreviation.description:
Set whether to abbreviate duration values
If true, the output will be in the form of "1h 2m" instead of "1 hour, 2 mins"

fraction.description: Set how ordinary fraction numbers should be displayed

oneOf.description: Set the number of digits to keep after the decimal point when formatting ordinary fraction numbers
The number of digits will be automatically determined based on the value

trailingZeros.description: Set when to keep trailing zeros

oneOf.description: Same as `default`
Use the behavior defined internally
Always keep trailing zeros
Never keep trailing zeros

noBuffer.description: Whether to disable the stdout application buffer

constants.description: List of strings to be used in custom format of modules

useSetupApi.description: Set if `SetupAPI` should be used on Windows to detect battery info, which supports multi batteries, but slower. Windows only

type.description: Print information of 1st-stage bootloader (name, version, release date, etc)

showDisconnected.description: Set if disconnected bluetooth devices should be printed

type.description: List bluetooth radios width supported version and vendor
Print motherboard name and other info
Print information of 2nd-stage bootloader (name, firmware, etc)
Print current brightness level of your monitors

ddcciSleep.description:
Set the sleep times (in ms) when sending DDC/CI requests.
See <https://www.ddcutil.com/performance_options/#option-sleep-multiplier> for detail

compact.description: Set if multiple results should be printed in one line

showPeCoreCount.description: Detect and display CPU frequency of different core types (eg. Pcore and Ecore) if supported

type.description: Print CPU usage. Costs some time to collect data

separate.description: Display CPU usage per CPU logical core, instead of an average result

waitTime.description: Wait time (in ms). CPU usage = (inUseEnd - inUseStart) / waitTime

oneOf.description: (whitespaces with background)

paddingLeft.description: Set the number of white spaces to print before the symbol

width.description: Set the block width in spaces

range.description: Set the range of colors in the blocks to print

shell.description:
Set the shell program to execute the command text
Default: cmd for Windows, /bin/sh for *nix

param.description:
Set the parameter used when starting the shell
If set to an empty string, it will be ignored
Default: /c for Windows, -c for *nix

text.description: Set the command text to be executed

type.description: Print a custom string, with or without key

key.description: Leave empty not to print the key

compactType.description: Set if all displays should be printed in one line

oneOf.description: Disable compact mode
Disable compact mode (kept for compatibility)
Print original resolutions
Print scaled resolutions
Print original resolutions with refresh rates
Print scaled resolutions with refresh rates

preciseRefreshRate.description: Set if decimal refresh rates should not be rounded into integers when printing

order.description: Set the order should be used when printing

oneOf.description: Use the default order
Use the detected order (kept for compatibility)
Sort by display name in ascending order
Sort by display name in descending order

type.description: Print partitions, space usage, disk type, etc

folders.description:
A list of folder paths for the disk output
Default: auto detection using mount-points
This option overrides other `show*` options

oneOf.description: A colon (semicolon on Windows) separated list of folder paths to get disk usage from
An array of folder paths to get disk usage from

hideFolders.description: A list of folder paths to hide from the disk output

oneOf.description: A colon (semicolon on Windows) separated list of folder paths to hide from the disk output
An array of folder paths to hide from the disk output

hideFS.description: A list of file systems to hide from the disk output

oneOf.description: A colon separated list of file systems to hide from the disk output
An array of file systems to hide from the disk output

showRegular.description: Set if regular volume should be printed

showExternal.description: Set if external volume should be printed

showHidden.description: Set if hidden volumes should be printed

showSubvolumes.description: Set if subvolumes should be printed

showReadOnly.description: Set if read only volumes should be printed

showUnknown.description: Set if unknown (unable to detect sizes) volumes should be printed

useAvailable.description:
Use f_bavail (lpFreeBytesAvailableToCaller for Windows) instead of f_bfree to calculate used bytes
May be required for macOS to display correct results

namePrefix.description: Show disks with given name prefix only

detectTotal.description: Detect total bytes instead of current rate

waitTime.description: Wait time (in ms). Disk I/O = (totalBytesEnd - totalBytesStart) / waitTime

slowVersionDetection.description:
Set if DE version should be detected with slow operations.
Should be unnecessary for most cases.
This is only used as a fallback method. Please file a bug report if you encounter any issues.

oneOf.description: Show IPv4 addresses only
Show IPv6 addresses only
Show both IPv4 and IPv6 addresses

showType.description: Specify the type of DNS servers should be detected

type.description: Print information of the default editor ($VISUAL or $EDITOR)

ignores.description: An array of case-insensitive device name prefixes to ignore

type.description: Print GPU names, graphic memory size, type, etc

driverSpecific.description:
Use driver specific method to detect more detailed GPU information (memory usage, core count, etc)
Requires the latest GPU drivers to be installed.

detectionMethod.description: Force using a specified method to detect GPUs

oneOf.description:
Query platform-specific graphics APIs.
Requires proper GPU drivers to be installed.
Supported on Linux, FreeBSD, Windows and macOS

Search PCI devices, which does not require GPU drivers to be installed.
Not supported on Windows and macOS

Use Vulkan API.
Slow and requires proper Vulkan drivers to be installed.
Used for Android

Use OpenCL API.
Slow and requires proper OpenCL drivers to be installed

Use OpenGL API.
Slow and only detects one GPU.
Used for OpenBSD

hideType.description: Specify the type of GPUs should not be printed

oneOf.description: Do not hide any GPUs
Do not hide any GPUs (kept for compatibility)
Hide integrated GPUs
Hide discrete GPUs
Hide unknown (unrecognized) GPUs

type.description: Print product name of your computer
Print init system (pid 1) name and version

ignores.description: An array of case-insensitive device name prefixes to ignore

type.description: Print login manager (desktop manager) name and version
List local IP addresses (v4 or v6), MAC addresses, etc

oneOf.description: Show the most useful IPv6 addresses
Do not show IPv6 addresses
Show only global unicast IPv6 addresses (2000::/3)
Show only unique local IPv6 addresses (fc00::/7)
Show only link-local IPv6 addresses (fe80::/10)
Show only IPv6 addresses that are not gua, ula or lla

showAllIps.description:
Show all IPs bound to the same interface.
By default only the firstly detected IP is shown

compact.description: Show all IPs in one line

namePrefix.description: Show IPs with given name prefix only

defaultRouteOnly.description:
Show ips that are used for default routing only
Doesn't work on Android

ndigits.description: Set the number of digits to keep after the decimal point

type.description: Print song name of currently playing

ignores.description: An array of case-insensitive device name prefixes to ignore

type.description: Alias of Display module (for backwards compatibility, deprecated)

namePrefix.description: Show IPs with given name prefix only

defaultRouteOnly.description:
Show ips that are used for default routing only
Doesn't work on Android

detectTotal.description: Detect total bytes instead of current rate

waitTime.description: Wait time (in ms). Net I/O = (totalBytesEnd - totalBytesStart) / waitTime

type.description: Print highest OpenCL version supported by the GPU
Print highest OpenGL version supported by the GPU

library.description: Set the OpenGL context creation library to use

oneOf.description: Prefer EGL on *nix; prefer platform-specific implementation on others
Use EGL, which works on TTY
Use GLX, requires X session (*nix only)

type.description: Print OS / or Linux distro name and version
List installed package managers and count of installed packages

oneOf.description:
List of package managers to be disabled when detecting
Warning: Some detection methods can be very slow.
Enable all package managers

combined.description: Whether to combine related package managers into single counts (e.g., nix-system + nix-user = nix)

namePrefix.description: Show disks with given name prefix only

type.description: Print power adapter name and charging watts
Print your public IP address, etc

url.description: The URL of public IP detection server to be used. Only HTTP protocol is supported

timeout.description:
Time in milliseconds to wait for the public ip server to respond.
0 to disable timeout

ipv6.description: Whether to use IPv6 for public IP detection server

string.description: Set the string to be printed by the separator line

outputColor.description: Set the color of the separator line

times.description: Set the times of separator string to repeat, or 0 to auto-detect

type.description: Print current shell name and version

soundType.description: Set what type of sound devices should be printed

oneOf.description: Print only main sound devices
Print only active sound devices
Print all sound devices

separate.description: Set if detailed swap devices should be reported on separate lines instead of a summary

type.description: Print current terminal name and version
Print font name and size used by current terminal
Print current terminal theme (foreground and background colors)
Print current theme of desktop environment
Print title, which contains your user name, hostname

fqdn.description: Set if the title should use fully qualified domain name

color.description: Set colors of the different part of title

user.description: Set color of the user name (left part)

at.description: Set color of the @ symbol (middle part)

host.description: Set color of the host name (right part)

type.description: Print info of Trusted Platform Module (TPM) Security Device

compact.description: Show all active users in one line

type.description: Print how long system has been running
Print highest Vulkan version supported by the GPU
Print image file path of current wallpaper

location.description:
The location to display
Must be URI encoded (e.g., a whitespace must be encoded as "+")

timeout.description:
Time in milliseconds to wait for the weather server to respond.
0 to disable timeout

outputFormat.description: The output weather format to be used (must be URI encoded)

type.description: Print connected Wi-Fi info (SSID, connection and security protocol)
Print window manager name and version

detectPlugin.description: Set if window manager plugin should be detected on supported platforms

type.description: Print current theme of window manager
